subject: RE: [junit] REQ: Pro side of "use inner classes to test  private stuff"
msgSnippet: ... Why? ... Doesn t the clutter help me in refactoring, too? Regards, Ilja
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>> So said Ilja Preuss on 2003-08-07 --------------------

>> To me, cluttering up the source code *is* an advantage in this case.
>> Testing private parts is a smell - if I need to do it, I want the
>> smell to be felt every time I need to work with it, I want it to be
>> ugly.
>
> Agreed, however if you assume that testing private parts is a
> necessity, then cluttering up the source code is not good.

Why?

> The necessity comes from the desire to add tests to legacy code to
> aid in refactoring.

Doesn't the clutter help me in refactoring, too?

Regards, Ilja
